Activity2.Description: HOUSING:FRANNIE PEABODY CENTER IS COMMITTED TO MEETING THE HOUSING AND RESIDENTIAL NEEDS OF PEOPLE LIVING WITH HIV/AIDS IN MAINE. HAVEN, FPC'S STATEWIDE HOUSING ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, PROVIDES TENANT-BASED RENTAL SUBSIDIES AND SHORT TERM RENT, MORTGAGE AND UTILITY PAYMENT ASSISTANCE TO LOW-INCOME PEOPLE LIVING WITH HIV/AIDS.

Activity3.Description: PREVENTION:FRANNIE PEABODY CENTER'S HIV PREVENTION AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS FOCUS ON TARGETED OUTREACH AND RECRUITMENT, REFERRALS TO TESTING, LINKAGES TO SUPPORT SERVICES AND MEDICAL CARE, PARTNER COUNSELING AND REFERRAL SERVICES AND LOW BARRIER ANONYMOUS RAPID HIV TESTING.

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PREVENT THE SPREAD OF HIV AND PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR PEOPLE LIVING WITH HIV/AIDS IN MAINE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: FRANNIE PEABODY CENTER'S MISSION IS TO PREVENT THE SPREAD OF HIV AND PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR PEOPLE LIVING WITH HIV/AIDS IN MAINE.
IRS990.Description: CASE MANAGEMENT:FRANNIE PEABODY CENTER ("FPC") SERVES HALF OF ALL MAINERS LIVING WITH HIV/AIDS WHO ARE ENGAGED IN CASE MANAGEMENT. FPC SERVES THOSE IN CUMBERLAND AND YORK COUNTIES, PROVIDING REFERRALS AND ADVOCACY TO MEET THE MEDICAL, PSYCHOLOGICAL, LEGAL AND PHYSICAL NEEDS OF CLIENTS. FPC ALSO ASSISTS WITH PAYMENTS FOR MEDICATIONS, DENTAL CARE, EYEGLASSES, AND NUTRITION.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: FORM 990, SCHEDULE D, PART XII, LINE 2(D): FUNDRAISING EXPENSES REPORTED ON FORM 990, PAGE 9, SCHEDULE VIII, LINE 8(B) FORM 990, SCHEDULE D, PART XIII, LINE 2(D): FUNDRAISING EXPENSES REPORTED ON FORM 990, PAGE 9, SCHEDULE VIII, LINE 8(B)

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FOR 2010, THE AGENCY REALIZED GREATER THAN USUAL REVENUES OVER EXPENSES RESULTING FROM SEVERAL UNIQUE SITUATIONS WHICH ARE NOT EXPECTED TO RE-OCCUR. SPECIFICALLY, IN NOVEMBER, 2010, THE AGENCY RELOCATED ITS ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAM OFFICES FROM VALLEY STREET TO 30 DANFORTH STREET IN PORTLAND, MAINE. THE PURPOSE OF THIS MOVE WAS TO ADDRESS PROGRAM NEEDS AND GROWTH; THE AGENCY HAS A SEVEN YEAR LEASE FOR THESE OFFICES. THE AGENCY'S COSTS FOR LEASEHOLD IMPROVEMENTS, FURNISHINGS AND EQUIPMENT RELATED TO THE MOVE WERE SUBSTANTIAL AND WERE PAID FROM CURRENT YEAR REVENUES. THESE COSTS ARE NOT REFLECTED AS EXPENSES IN FORM 990, BUT ARE INCLUDED IN FIXED ASSETS ON THE AGENCY'S BALANCE SHEET BECAUSE THEY HAVE EXTENDED USEFUL LIVES. DEPRECIATION FOR THESE ASSETS WILL BE CHARGED TO EXPENSE IN FUTURE YEARS OVER THE USEFUL LIVES DETERMINED BY THE AGENCY. IN ADDITION, FRANNIE PEABODY CENTER RECEIVED A MUCH APPRECIATED, THOUGH UNEXPECTED, $40,000 BEQUEST. THESE FUNDS WILL ENABLE THE AGENCY TO CONTINUE EXPANDING ITS PROGRAMMING AND SERVICES TO CLIENTS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 4
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DURING 2010 THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWED THE DIRECTOR TERM LIMITS IN THE BYLAWS AND PROPOSED CHANGES TO THEM. AT ITS SEPTEMBER 2010 MEETING, THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS UNANIMOUSLY ADOPTED THE BYLAWS CHANGES REGARDING TERMS OF DIRECTORS AS RECOMMENDED BY THE COMMITTEE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND DIRECTOR OF FINANCE ASSIST THE AUDITING FIRM WITH PREPARATION OF THE ANNUAL FORM 990. THEY REVIEW A DRAFT OF FORM 990 FOR COMPLETENESS, ACCURACY AND RECONCILIATION WITH THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THEY ALSO REVIEW THE NARRATIVES DESCRIBING THE AGENCY'S MISSION, PROGRAMS, POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE UP TO DATE AND ACCURATE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS CHARGED WITH REVIEW AND FINAL APPROVAL OF THE FORM 990 BECAUSE THE BOARD OFFICERS HAVE THE NECESSARY EXPERTISE AND EXPERIENCE TO DO SO. THEY ARE PROVIDED WITH A DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 FOR PRELIMINARY REVIEW, THEN MEET WITH MANAGEMENT AND THE AUDITORS TO RESOLVE ANY QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS. WHEN THEIR REVIEW IS COMPLETED, THE FORM 990 IS FILED.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FRANNIE PEABODY CENTER USES THE MAINE ASSOCIATION OF NON-PROFITS COMPENSATION HANDBOOK TO ASSESS APPROPRIATE COMPENSATION LEVELS AND PROVIDE COMPARABILITY DATA REGARDING COMPENSATION. THE MAINE ASSOCIATION OF NON-PROFITS PUBLISHES COMPENSATION SURVEYS BI-ANNUALLY. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE TOTAL AGENCY SALARIES (INCLUDING EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR COMPENSATION) DURING THE ANNUAL BUDGET PROCESS. THE AGENCY BENEFITS PACKAGE IS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD AS A PART OF THE ANNUAL INSURANCE RENEWAL; ALL MANAGEMENT AND STAFF ARE ELIGIBLE FOR THE SAME BENEFITS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PERSONNEL POLICIES. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND MANAGEMENT TEAM ARE CHARGED WITH DEVELOPMENT OF THE SPECIFIC POSITIONS WITHIN THE AGENCY, THE JOB DESCRIPTIONS, AND THE APPROPRIATE SALARY RANGE FOR EACH. THESE ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AS NECESSARY AS WELL AS IN CONJUCTION WITH BUDGET PREPARATION.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FRANNIE PEABODY CENTER MAKES AVAILABLE, UPON REQUEST, ITS FORM 990 AND ALL OTHER INFORMATION AND DOCUMENTS REQUIRED BY LAW TO BE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION. AT THIS TIME THERE ARE NO PLANS TO INCLUDE THIS INFORMATION ON THE AGENCY'S WEBSITE. INFORMATION MAY ALSO BE ACCESSED ON THE INTERNET AT THE GUIDESTAR.COM WEBSITE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FRANNIE PEABODY CENTER CURRENTLY DOES NOT HAVE A FORMAL POLICY REGARDING PUBLIC DISCLOSURE OF GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. REQUESTS FOR THAT INFORMATION WOULD BE ADDRESSED ON A CASE BY CASE BASIS.

THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, IN CONJUNCTION WITH MANAGEMENT, OVERSEES THE AUDIT. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS DEVOTES A FULL MEETING TO REVIEW THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND RELATED CORRESPONDENCE WITH REPRESENTATIVES OF THE AUDIT FIRM. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS RESPONSIBLE FOR SELECTION OF THE AUDIT FIRM. THERE ARE NO CHANGES FROM PROCEDURES IN PREVIOUS YEARS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CONFLICT OF INTEREST, WHISTLEBLOWER, AND DOCUMENTS RETENTION POLICIES
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Page 6, Part VI, Section B, Line 12(A), 12(B), 12(C), 13, 14
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALL EMPLOYEES RECEIVE A COPY OF FRANNIE PEABODY CENTER'S POLICIES AND PROCEDURES MANUAL AT HIRE; THEY MUST ACKNOWLEDGE IN WRITING THEIR RECIPT OF THE MANUAL AS WELL AS THEIR RESPONSIBILITY TO READ AND UNDERSTAND ITS CONTENTS. THE MANUAL INCLUDES CONFIDENTIALITY AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES, WHICH ARE ALSO REVIEWED PERIODICALLY IN AGENCY STAFF MEETINGS. DURING 2010, FRANNIE PEABODY CENTER DID NOT HAVE A WRITTEN WHISTLEBLOWER POLICY, BUT FOLLOWED THE GUIDANCE OF THE FEDERAL WHISTLEBLOWERS' PROTECTION ACT. THIS INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE TO STAFF THROUGH POSTED NOTICES IN COMMON AREAS AT ALL AGENCY LOCATIONS. IN MARCH, 2011, FRANNIE PEABODY CENTER REVISED ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY TO A COMPREHENSIVE POLICY INCLUDING BOARD MEMBERS, MANAGEMENT, AND STAFF. AT THAT TIME, THE AGENCY ALSO ADOPTED A FORMAL WRITTEN EMPLOYEE PROTECTION (WHISTLEBLOWER) POLICY. STAFF RECIEVED ORIENTATION ON AND COPIES OF THIS POLICY AT THE APRIL 2011 STAFF MEETING. AT THAT TIME, THEY WERE REQUIRED TO DOCUMENT IN WRITING THAT THEY RECEIVED THE POLICY. NEW HIRES AFTER APRIL, 2011, RECIEVE THE REVISED CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND EMPLOYEE PROTECTION POLICIES AS PART OF THEIR NEW HIRE PACKETS AND ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN THE RECEIPT ACKOWLEDGEMENTS. THE AGENCY INTENDS TO INCORPORATE THESE INTO ITS POLICY AND PROCEDURES MANUAL AT ITS NEXT REVISION, CURRENTLY PLANNED FOR EARLY 2012. AS NOTED ABOVE, FRANNIE PEABODY CENTER HAS FORMAL WRITTEN CONFIDENTIALITY POLICIES WHICH ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE MANAGEMENT TEAM AND THE PROGRAM EVALUATOR. EMPLOYEES AND PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS ARE TRAINED ON THESE POLICIES AT HIRE AND ANNUALLY THEREAFTER DURING HIPAA (HEALTH INSURANCE PORTABILITY AND ACCOUNTABILITY ACT OF 1996) PRIVACY AND SECURITY TRAINING. EMPLOYEES AND PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN STATEMENTS OF CONFIDENTIALITY AT EACH OF THESE TRAININGS. THE CONFIDENTIALITY POLICIES INCLUDE COMPLIANCE WITH AGENCY PROCEDURES FOR CONFIDENTIAL DESTRUCTION OF DOCUMENTS. THE AGENCY CURRENTLY DOES NOT HAVE A FORMAL WRITTEN DOCUMENTS STORAGE AND DESTRUCTION SCHEDULE FOR AGENCY RECORDS, ALTHOUGH LOGS OF MATERIALS IN STORAGE ARE MAINTAINED. THE AGENCY FOLLOWS HIPAA AND MAINE DHHS GUIDELINES FOR DESTRUCTION OF CLIENT RECORDS, AND IS CONTINUING TO WORK WITH FEDERAL AND STATE FUNDING SOURCES TO COORDINATE THEIR SPECIFIC DOCUMENTS STORAGE AND CONFIDENTIAL DESTRUCTION REQUIREMENTS INTO A COMPREHENSIVE WRITTEN PROGRAM FOR THE AGENCY. EXTERNAL VENDORS AND OTHERS WHO VISIT PROGRAM LOCATIONS ARE PROVIDED, AT ENTRY, WITH THE STATEMENT OF CONFIDENTIALITY AND ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN IT PRIOR TO ACCESSING ANY LOCATION. AGENCY DIRECTORS RECEIVE COPIES OF THE BYLAWS AND DIRECTOR POLICIES, INCLUDING THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY (AS OF MARCH 2011). THEY ARE ALSO PROVIDED HIPAA PRIVACY AND SECURITY TRAINING WHEN THEY JOIN THE BOARD; AT THAT TIME THEY ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN STATEMENTS OF CONFIDENTIALITY. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ALSO ATTENDS ANNUAL HIPAA TRAINING AND SIGNS NEW STATEMENTS OF CONFIDENTIALITY AT THAT TIME. DURING 2010 THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS DID NOT HAVE A FORMAL WRITTEN POLICY REGARDING CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, NOR DID IT REQUIRE DIRECTORS TO DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. BOARD MEMBERS ARE SCREENED BY A NOMINATING COMMITTEE AND THEN INTERVIEWED AND VOTED ON BY THE FULL BOARD. DURING THAT PROCESS INQUIRIES ARE MADE REGARDING ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS. ALSO, THE AGENCY BYLAWS SPECIFICALLY PROHIBIT COMPENSATION TO DIRECTORS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS EXPECTS ITS MEMBERS TO NOTIFY THE BOARD PRESIDENT AS SOON AS ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT ARISES. THE BOARD RESOOLVES CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ON A CASE BY CASE BASIS. SEVERAL CURRENT BOARD MEMBERS HAVE EXISTING CONFLICTS OF INTEREST (PRIMARILY DUE TO THEIR EMPLOYMENT) WHICH ARE KNOWN TO THE BOARD AND MANAGEMENT. FROM TIME TO TIME, BOARD CONSIDERATION OF VARIOUS MATTERS HAVE CAUSED THESE MEMBERS TO RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM DISCUSSION AND VOTES.

Form990ScheduleRPartI.PrimaryActivities: PASS THROUGH ENTITY FOR VENDOR PAYMENTS
